main.description: Index record for a WebDataset-backed dataset with references to storage location and sample schema

schemaRef.description: AT-URI reference to the schema record for this dataset's samples

storage.description: Storage location for dataset files (WebDataset tar archives)

metadata.description: Msgpack-encoded metadata dict for arbitrary extended key-value pairs. Use this for additional metadata beyond the core top-level fields (license, tags, size). Top-level fields are preferred for discoverable/searchable metadata.

tags.description: Searchable tags for dataset discovery. Aligns with Schema.org keywords property.

license.description: License identifier or URL. SPDX identifiers recommended (e.g., MIT, Apache-2.0, CC-BY-4.0) or full SPDX URLs (e.g., http://spdx.org/licenses/MIT). Aligns with Schema.org license property.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this dataset record was created

metadataSchemaRef.description: Optional AT-URI reference to a schema record defining the structure of this dataset's content metadata. When present, contentMetadata is validated against this schema at write time.

contentMetadata.description: Dataset-level content metadata (e.g., instrument settings, acquisition parameters). Structure is validated against the schema referenced by metadataSchemaRef when present. Stored as an open JSON object.

manifests.description: Per-shard manifest metadata for query-based access. Each entry corresponds to a shard in the storage union (matched by array index). Optional â€” datasets without manifests are still fully usable via sequential iteration.

shardManifestRef.description: References to manifest sidecar data for a single shard. The header contains schema info, sample count, and per-field aggregates. The samples file is a Parquet table with per-sample metadata for query-based access.

header.description: Manifest JSON header containing schema info, sample count, and per-field aggregates (min/max/mean for numeric, value_counts for categorical)

samples.description: Parquet file with per-sample metadata (__key__, __offset__, __size__, plus queryable field values)

shardChecksum.description: Content hash for shard integrity verification. Algorithm is flexible to allow SHA-256, BLAKE3, or other hash functions.

samples.description: Total number of samples in the dataset
